H0.text: Air is the resource that paper recycling helps conserve the most in a recycling program where people separate paper from their other trash and send it to factories to be turned into new products.

H1.text: Gasoline is what paper recycling helps conserve the most in a recycling program where people separate paper from other trash and send it to factories to make new products.

H2.text: Trees are what paper recycling helps conserve the most in a recycling program where people separate paper from their other trash and the paper is sent to factories to be turned into new products.

H3.text: Water is the resource most conserved by paper recycling, which involves separating paper from other trash and sending it to factories to be turned into new products.

A4.text: Recycling one ton of newsprint saves about 1 ton of wood while recycling 1 ton of printing or copier paper saves slightly more than 2 tons of wood.

A5.text: The United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has found that recycling causes 35% less water pollution and 74% less air pollution than making virgin paper.
